result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin L. Schumacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Take all medications as prescribed.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
-----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-----------------------------------

ADDRESS INFO for Robin L. Schumacher

Prior: 209 York St., Beaver Dam, WI 53916
2nd Amended Criminal Complaint
BOND QUASHED

10:35 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  DA Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robin L. Schumacher in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Matter is before the Court for plea and sentencing.  The first issue that the Court wants to discuss is the amendment of the charges.  Court would like to know the basis for the Amended Information.  Response by Atty Necci.  Atty Necci still does not have drug test results and has been waiting since August of last year for the Wauwatosa Police Dept. to take them to the crime lab.  Atty Necci expresses his frustration and makes further record as to the 2 charges that the State could potentially prove.  10:40 am  Response by Atty Christopherson making further record as to all the facts and circumstances of this matter and setting forth how this alternative resolution was negotiated.  10:44 am  Atty Necci makes additional record.  10:46 am  Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys.  10:54 am  Court takes a short break to consider this and will return in a bit.  11:05 am  Court in session.  Court makes record.  Court finds it is not in the public interest to accept this plea agreement.  Atty Necci indicates that even if he had the drug test results, he believes this is an appropriate plea agreement and makes further record.  Response by Atty Christopherson asking the Court to make a record as to its basis for rejecting the plea agreement.  Court does not agree with the basis for the dismissal of the 3 counts.  Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  Parties propose change to plea agreement whereby Counts 1 through 4 would be dismissed and read-in.  
11:15 am  Court has plea colloquy with Ms. Schumacher.  Response by Atty Christopherson to Court's questions.  

11:18 am  Ms. Schumacher enters Guilty plea to Ct #5 of 2nd Amended Criminal Complaint.  
Court finds her plea to have been entered knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and finds her guilty.  
Counts #1 through #4 are dismissed and read-in.  Court imposes the agreed upon sentence of the parties.  

Withheld sentence - 12 months probation
AODA assessment and treatment if any
Take all medication as prescribed
No weapons
No alcohol, drugs or drug paraphernalia
Counseling as recommended by Agent
No driving without a valid DL
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs and DOC supervision fees.  
11:20 am  Court in recess.
of Jane H. Christopherson
To Adjourn Plea Hearing

Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Robin L. Schumacher in court with Atty Jane Heather Christopherson.  
Matter is before the Court for a final pre-trial.  Atty Christopherson advises that the parties have reached an agreement which contemplates the defendant pleading to Ct 5 of an Amended Complaint yet to be filed.  Attorney Schumacher indicates there needs to be a factual basis and there are a number of civil matters involved in the factual basis.  There was an internal investigation that is now done.  Jury Trial is canceled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2020 at 01:15 pm.
Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson appeared.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Defendant's Demand

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson appeared.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to Appear and Act

2:33 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  
Defendant Robin L. Schumacher in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter is before the Court on the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss based upon multiplicitous charges.  
The State has filed a 2nd Amended Complaint which resolves this Motion.  
Attorney Christopherson wishes to make a record with record to the identification of the controlled substances in this matter.  
She has not yet received an analysis of the drugs involved in this case.  
Attorney Christopherson is now withdrawing the Motion with the changes that were made to the complaint itself.  
Attorney Necci will have the results as soon as the crime lab returns the results to their office.  
Typically they return the results in conjunction with the trial dates that are set.  
Attorney Christopherson has reviewed the 2nd amended complaint with her client and is entering not guilty pleas to the charges in the amended complaint.  
Attorney Christopherson will also be requesting the DNA packet.  
Court will set a status conference in 60 days.  
Since these are misdemeanors, Attorney Christopherson can file an authorization to act and appear, and the Court will then waive the Defendant's appearance at the next hearing.  
Status conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Motion hearing at 08-25-2015 02:30 pm
Response by State to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss
Motion to Dismiss:  Multiplicitous Charge
Not guilty plea entered.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson appeared.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes Filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 07-17-2015 01:15 pm
